snippet: “The Fault in Our Stars,” a teenage romance starring Shailene Woodley, had a strong opening weekend, forcing the highly publicized Tom Cruise vehicle, “Edge of Tomorrow,” to No. 3.
abstract: Movie The Fault in Our Stars, based on John Green book about two teenagers who fall in love while battling cancer, takes in spectacular $48.2 million on opening weekend, beating sci-fi movie Edge of Tomorrow, which took in $29.1 million; results come as surprise, especially given that The Fault in Our Stars was promoted largely through social media.
lead_paragraph: “The Fault in Our Stars,” a teenage romance starring Shailene Woodley, had a strong opening weekend, forcing the highly publicized Tom Cruise vehicle, “Edge of Tomorrow,” to No. 3.

headline.seo: ‘The Fault in Our Stars’ Tops Weekend Box Office
headline.main: Teenage Angst Trumps Sci-Fi at the Box Office
headline.print_headline: Teenage Angst Trumps Sci-Fi At the Box Office
